description: Given a user pool ID and identity provider (IdP) name, returns details about the IdP.

parameters.name: UserPoolId
parameters.description: The ID of the user pool that has the IdP that you want to describe..

parameters.name: ProviderName
parameters.description: The name of the IdP that you want to describe.

nested_items.name: IdentityProvider
nested_items.description: The details of the requested IdP.

nested_items.name: UserPoolId
nested_items.description: The ID of the user pool associated with the IdP.

nested_items.name: ProviderName
nested_items.description: A friendly name for the IdP.

nested_items.name: ProviderType
nested_items.description: The type of IdP. Either SAML, OIDC, or a named social identity provider.

nested_items.name: ProviderDetails
nested_items.description: The scopes, URLs, and identifiers for your external identity provider. The following examples describe the provider detail keys for each IdP type. These values and their schema are subject to change. Social IdP authorize_scopes values must match the values listed here.

nested_items.name: AttributeMapping
nested_items.description: A mapping of IdP attributes to standard and custom user pool attributes.

nested_items.name: IdpIdentifiers
nested_items.description: A list of IdP identifiers. IdP identifiers are strings that represent friendly names or domain names of IdPs, for example MyIdP or auth.example.com. You can choose to route user authorization requests to the right IdP with either IdP identifiers or IdP names. For more information, see identity_provider and idp_identifier at Authorize endpoint.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the item was modified. Amazon Cognito returns this timestamp in UNIX epoch time format. Your SDK might render the output in a human-readable format like ISO 8601 or a Java Date object.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the item was created. Amazon Cognito returns this timestamp in UNIX epoch time format. Your SDK might render the output in a human-readable format like ISO 8601 or a Java Date object.
